H0.text: Cellular respiration is the process, which is in many ways the opposite of photosynthesis, that shows the interdependence of producers and consumers.

H1.text: Primarily respiration is the process that, in many ways, is the opposite of photosynthesis and shows the interdependence of producers and consumers.

H2.text: Decomposition is a process that is in many ways the opposite of photosynthesis and shows the interdependence of producers and consumers.

H3.text: Osmosis is the process that, in many ways the opposite of photosynthesis, shows the interdependence of producers and consumers.

A4.text: Decomposition is the process by which dead organic substances are broken down into simpler organic or inorganic matter such as carbon dioxide, water, simple sugars and mineral salts.

A5.text: In fact, decomposition contributes over 90 percent of carbon dioxide released each year.
